summary: The document outlines the decision-making procedures of a committee at Deutsche Bank, detailing quorum requirements, majority voting rules, and the veto rights of the Chairperson. It emphasizes the importance of having a quorum for decisions and the processes for making decisions, including the ability to use electronic means.
keyFacts: The committee requires a quorum of the Chairperson and at least 50% of Voting Members to make decisions.
Decisions are made by a qualified majority of 67%.
The Chairperson has veto rights over decisions until the minutes are finalized.
Meetings can be held electronically if necessary.
Non-quorate meetings can only serve for information sharing and decision preparation.
